alert.note: Alert for Brown; McCulloch; San Saba (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 10:56PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Brown, northeastern McCulloch and northwestern San Saba Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1055 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms from Brownwood to Brookesmith, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Early, Richland Springs, Algerita, Bangs, Blanket, Elm Grove, Winchell, Zephyr, Brookesmith, Rochelle, Camp Bowie, Skeeterville, Placid, Mercury, Hall, Locker, Milburn, Spring Creek and Us-190 Near The Mcculloch-San Saba County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for west central Texas.
